contentrichtext.text: '''Baron Gretton''', of Stapleford in the County of Leicester, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1944 for the brewer and [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] politician [[John Gretton, 1st Baron Gretton|John Gretton]]. He was head of the brewery firm of Bass, Ratcliff & Gretton Ltd of [[Burton upon Trent]] and also represented [[Derbyshire South (UK Parliament constituency)|Derbyshire South]], [[Rutland (UK Parliament constituency)|Rutland]] and [[Burton (UK Parliament constituency)|Burton]] in Parliament. His son, the second Baron, also represented Burton in the [[British House of Commons|House of Commons]] as a Conservative. {{As of|2010}} the title is held by the latter's grandson, the fourth Baron, who succeeded his father in 1989. His mother, [[Jennifer Gretton, Lady Gretton]], has been [[Lord Lieutenant of Leicestershire]] since 2003. The family seat was [[Stapleford Park]], [[Leicestershire]]. American fast-food restaurateur and hotelier Bob Payton bought it in 1988 to convert into a hotel. He restored the buildings, according to his obituary "hiring [[Wedgwood]], [[Turnbull & Asser]], [[Crabtree & Evelyn]] to decorate its rooms".<ref>[http://www.independent.co.uk/news/people/obituary-bob-payton-1413990.html Bob Payton's obituary in ''The Independent'']</ref> ==Barons Gretton (1944)== *[[John Gretton, 1st Baron Gretton]] (1867–1947) *[[John Gretton, 2nd Baron Gretton|John Frederic Gretton, 2nd Baron Gretton]] (1902–1982) *[[John Gretton, 3rd Baron Gretton|John Henrik Gretton, 3rd Baron Gretton]] (1941–1989) * [[John Gretton, 4th Baron Gretton|John Lysander Gretton, 4th Baron Gretton]] (b. 1975) The [[heir apparent]] is the present holder's son the Hon.
